sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09

sentences.sentence: The Ukrainian counter-offensive is meeting strong resistance from Russian troops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Casualties are heavy and the advance is slow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Still, Kyiv claims on Thursday to have regained control of some 100 square kilometers of territories. At the end of a meeting on the contact group in support of Ukraine in Brussels, US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin says that Ukraine still has a lot of firepower left to conduct a counteroffensive. I think the Russians have shown us that same five vehicles about a thousand times from ten different angles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But quite frankly the Ukrainians have still have a lot of combat capability, combat power. The chief of the UN's International Atomic Energy Agency Rafael Grossi visited the Zaporizhia nuclear power plant on Thursday to check on the potential risks caused by the destruction of the Kakhovka Dam.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: I would say there are two elements basically. On the one hand, we can see that the situation is serious, the consequences are there and they are real. At the same time, there are measures that are being taken to stabilize the situation.

sentences.sentence: These images show Ukrainian servicemen firing German howitzers near Bakhmut.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Together with the Netherlands, Germany has sent 14 of the self-propelled howitzers to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The delegation of four African leaders and three senior officials who are visiting Ukraine say they want to seek an end to the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: African governments, however, are divided as to who to blame.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Last year in a UN vote, only 28 out of 54 of them were prepared to condemn Russia's invasion. Their visit on Friday was interrupted by air raid sirens sounding as Russia fired more missiles at Ukraine's capital. Ukraine's foreign minister said the attack sent a message that Russia wants war, not peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: The delegation also visited Bucha, where hundreds of Ukrainians were massacred by Russian forces at the start of the war. The leaders of South Africa, Senegal and Uganda haven't condemned Russia, whilst another three, who are senior leaders from Egypt, Zambia and Comoros, have. But all seven of them do agree that fertilizer and food supplies from Ukraine to Africa that have been affected by the war should be increased.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Swiss cyclist Gino Mada has died from the severe injuries he suffered in a high-speed

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: crash whilst descending a mountain in the Tour de Suisse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In a statement, his Bahrain victorious team said the 26-year-old had died despite the best efforts of hospital staff to save him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Mada's death was announced half an hour before the start of Friday's stage. It was then cancelled and in a tribute to him, the peloton rode for 20 kilometres along the route as fans at the roadside held out flowers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Pope Francis was discharged from Rome's Gemelli Hospital on Friday morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: We know that he had remained in the hospital after undergoing abdominal surgery last Friday. He left in a wheelchair. He spoke with well wishes and extended his thanks to all health care staff for their professionalism and efforts. Now, the Vatican confirmed that doctors reported that the pontiffs last night in hospital went well and that the clinical course continues regularly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Now we know that all audiences have been suspended until the 18th of June, although the pontiff had resumed work from the hospital and is expected to resume all his activities, including travel, as soon as possible. Giorgio Orlandi for Euronews in Rome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Cyclone Biparjoy made landfall on Thursday evening as a vast swathe of western India and neighbouring southern Pakistan braced for flash floods, heavy rain and high winds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Biparjoy, which means disaster in Bengali, hit the coast of the Indian state of Gujarat, accompanied by winds of 125 kilometers per hour. More than 175,000 people have been relocated from the area through which Biparjoy is expected to pass due to the risk of flooding and the anticipated total destruction of certain buildings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: I was the first person who has access to HRT before I was 18. Living in Europe as a transgender person can be complicated, especially when you're young.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In 2022, there was one of the highest upticks in violence against Europe's LGBTQ plus community in almost a decade, especially for its transgender community. Some EU member states have passed progressive gender legislation, yet others have further restricted access to trans health care for minors. This Pride Month, we at Your News spoke to some of the people trying to make gender-affirming care more accessible in the bloc. For Alex, the process was relatively rapid, but it quickly became more difficult for those after him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: They just let me do that because I was 17 and 10 months and because my parents were very supportive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: I just talked to my endocrinologist a few days ago and she said that they were forced to shut down the system because there wasn't enough people who would like to work for that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In Ireland, waiting lists can be up to seven years long. out of sheer desperation are trying to access healthcare abroad and access medication abroad and online but without any medical supervision here in Ireland, which is something that's very dangerous.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In Spain, GPs will generally refer young people to a clinic that will help them access the care they want, according to its largest LGBTQ plus org.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But it all depends on the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: For some, it's not just about access to care, but also about being accepted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: For me, I think when my family started accepting it and they called me the right pronouns and they called me by my name, I think it does like half or more of the job.
